page.title: 17An Old Lady's Day in Alford
page.content: The lady in question is 84 years of age and suffers from arthritis which means she cannot walk very well. She lives in Hamilton Road, Alford, Lincolnshire on her own. She gets up at about 9.30am, makes her breakfast, washes up her dirty pots and looks at the daily newspaper; the rest of the morning is spent preparing for her lunch. On a Friday afternoon she goes to the Senior Citizens Club. This is held in the Congregational Church Hall, Alford and begins at 1.30 pm. At this club she plays card games and chats to her friends. The club finishes at 4.15 pm. She then has her tea at 5.00 pm. She then reads and watches television until about 10.00 pm, when she goes to bed with a cup of coffee and a biscuit.
